trivia: Regular time ended in 0-0. Two additional extra time periods were played, the first of 15 minutes and the second of 6 minutes (due to lack of light).
Despite goalless draw, the cup was given to Uruguay as a thank you for their visit.
Eliseo Brown, whose conquest generated a legend.  Eliseo was said to have dribbled seven Uruguayans before putting the ball in the net.
First match played with the Albiceleste (light blue/white vertical stripes) shirt.

venue.name: San Lorenzo de Almagro BUENOS AIRES
Estadio Monumental Antonio Vespucio Liberti, Buenos Aires

trivia: The game was abandoned after 23 minutes due to torrential rain, with a 0–0 scoreline.

venue.name: Estadio Monumental Antonio Vespucio Liberti, Buenos Aires

trivia: Argentina team was formed 2 weeks before the game from the five-man Independiete forward line, the Boca Juniors defence and Racing's midfield.
First Grillo goal is called "impossible goal" because of the angle it was scored from.
"There was no doubt about South Americans superiority. The FA XI were completely dazzled by the quick accurate Argentinians and our defence at the end was almost at panic stations." (Daily Express)
This match is considered an unofficial international by England (Buenos Aires League XI v Football Association League XI).
